Data: {"recipient_id": "e683e790-99d5-4139-bf32-065cd54deee5", "custom": {"attachment": {"type": "template", "payload": {"template_type": "simple_form", "title": "Information for Ad Support Ticket", "description": "This form is used to collect user information in case the user needs additional help and a Jira Ticket needs to be filed with our Support Team.", "descriptionPosition": "top", "hidden_reply": true, "reply_text": "The user completes the submission of the form", "submit_button_title": "Send", "intent_name": "submit_form", "cancel_button": {"title": "Cancel", "type": "postback", "payload": "/cancel_for_input_data", "url": null, "is_enabled": false, "hidden_reply": true}, "is_mailerlite_form": false, "fields": [{"title": "Name", "type": "text", "icon_url": "https://seachat.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/images/icon-name.svg", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "_NAME"}, {"title": "Email", "type": "text", "icon_url": "https://seachat.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/images/icon-email.svg", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "_EMAIL"}, {"title": "Account ID", "type": "text", "icon_url": "", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "VAR_0001"}], "form_id": "ee27568f0b9f4826a7215c8197548501"}}}}

Message: Hi, I’m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
I'm having a lot of trouble getting the events to fire correctly.
I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble with event tracking. Could you let me know if you're using Pixel Tracking or Postback Tracking? This will help me provide more specific guidance.

I attempted postback in the beginning, but now most recently just pixel. my test links are successful at setup, but my campaigns still show zeros for all event activity, which has to be incorrect because I am getting engagement on my pages

Thanks for the details! Since you're using Pixel Tracking, let's troubleshoot the pixel implementation. Could you confirm how your pixel is implemented? Are you using Custom Code, Google Tag Manager (GTM), or Shopify Integration?

Alright, since you're using custom code, please ensure that the base pixel code is added to your landing page URL and the custom pixel code is placed on the event page where the user action takes place. Have you performed the action that should trigger the pixel, like simulating a purchase if it's a complete_payment event? If not, please try these steps and let me know if it helps. If the issue persists, you might want to contact adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
Yes, I've done all that. I haven't used complete_payment as the only events I'm looking to track right now are view_content and click_button

Got it! For tracking events like view_content and click_button, ensure that the custom pixel code is correctly placed on the pages where these actions occur. Verify if the base pixel loads correctly on your webpage, and check if the custom event loads after going through any redirects. If everything seems correct but still doesn't work, you might want to simulate these actions again to see if they trigger the pixel. If issues persist, reaching out to adsupport@newsbreak.com could be helpful.
how do i delete the old events in my dashboard? I keep having to retest these issues and create new events and my dashboard is getting cluttered

Unfortunately, events cannot be deleted from the dashboard. If you have old events that are no longer needed, you can rename them with a prefix like 'DO NOT USE' to help keep your dashboard organized. This way, you can distinguish between active and inactive events without causing any issues with your campaigns.

Hi, I’ve been running a campaign using the previously supported __CALLBACK_PARAM__ for click ID tracking in my URL. I recently discovered that this token no longer populates, causing all of my subid tracking and conversion attribution to break mid-campaign. I would appreciate any clarification on when this change was made, and whether any ad credit or guidance can be offered due to the impact on my campaign’s performance.

I'm sorry to hear about the issues you're facing with your campaign. The __CALLBACK_PARAM__ is crucial for tracking, and any changes can significantly impact performance. Unfortunately, I don't have specific information on when this change was made. I recommend reaching out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com for detailed guidance and to discuss any potential ad credit due to the disruption. They will be able to provide more insights and assistance tailored to your situation.

I'm still waiting on a response from support. They still havent addressed how they just changed how tracking is formatted on the platform without notifying advertisers with campaigns already running. I've lost multiple days of tracking and wasted adspend because of this.

I understand your frustration with the situation, and it's important to have consistent tracking for your campaigns. While I don't have direct control over support response times, I recommend following up with them via email at adsupport@newsbreak.com to ensure your concerns are addressed promptly. You might also want to inquire about any compensation or adjustments due to the tracking changes. Your feedback is valuable, and they should be able to provide more clarity on the issue.
